Witodlice man lædde Iosep on Egypta land & hine gebohte Putiphar se <afyreda>, Pharaones heres ealdor, Egiptisc man, æt þam Ismaelitiscum mannum þe hine þyder læddon.
& Drihten wæs mid him: se man wæs weldonde on eallum þingum, & wunode on his hlafordes huse.
He wiste ful georne þæt God hine lufode, & ealle þa þing þe he dide, he dide be his dihte.
Iosep hæfde micle gyfe æt his hlaforde & þenode him; & betæhte him eal þæt he ahte to bewitenne.
& Drihten bletsode þæs Egiptiscean æhta for Iosepes þingon, & gemænifylde his speda ægþer ge on tunum ge on landum.
Iosep wæs fæger & wlitig on ansine.
Witodlice his hlæfdige lufode hine, & cwæþ to him: Slap mid me.
& he nateshwon hire þæs tiðian nolde, ac he cwæþ: Min hlaford me hæfþ betæht ealle his þing, & he nat hwæt he ealles hæfþ.
Næfþ he nan þing þæt ne sy on minum anwealde buton þu þe his wif eart: hu mæg ic swa ifele wiþ hine don & wiþ God singian?
Þylcum wordum heo him befealh ælce dæg, & þæt wif wearþ wraþ þam geongum cnapan; & he ascunode unrihthæmed.
Hit gelamp sume dæg þæt Iosep wæs ana innan his hlafordes huse, & heo teah hine be his claþum, & cwæþ to him: Slap mid me; þa ætarn he ut & forlet his wæfel on hire handum.

Þa hrymde heo to hyre hywum, & cwæþ: Nu he lædde inn þysne Ebreiscean man, þæt he bysmrode us; he eode in to me to ðam þæt he me ofername, & þa he gehyrde þæt ic hrymde, þa forlet he hys wæfels & fleah ut.
Þysne unwrenc heo geðohte; & þa hire hlaford ham com, þa cwæþ heo: Se Ebreiscea wealh þe ðu hider brohtest eode in to me þæt he me bysmrude, & ða ic hrymde, þa forlet he hys wæfels & arn ut.
Ða se hlaford þæt gehyrde, þa wearþ he swiþe yrre, & gelyfde swiðe wel hyre wordum, & wearp Iosep on cweartern þær man þæs cyninges ræplingas heold, & he wæs þær belocen.
& Drihten wæs mid him & miltsode him & gedide ðæt þæs cwearternes ealdor him wearþ swiðe hold.
Se him betæhte ealle þa gebundenan men ðe þær gehæfte wæron.
& he ne cuþe nan þing þæron, þa hi him betæhte wæron; ac Drihten wæs mid him & dihte him hwæt he don sceolde.
Þa þis wæs þus gedon, þa gelamp hit þæt twegen afyrede men agylton wyþ heora hlaford, Egypta cynges byrle & his bæcestre.
& Pharao <wearþ> swyðe yrre.
Ðara oþer bewiste hys byrlas, oþer hys bæcestran.
Ða dide hi man on cwearten, on þam wæs eac Iosep gebunden.
& þæs cwearternes hyrde hi betæhte Iosepe, & he þenode him.
Binnan fyrste hi gesawon begen swefn on anre nihte.
Ða wæron hi swiþe unrote on merigen.
& cwædon to Iosepe: Wit gesawon swefn, ac wit nyton hwa hit unc atelle hwæt hit behealde; ða cwæþ Iosep: Secgaþ me hwæt gyt gesawon.
Þa rehte þæra byrla ealdor him his swefn, & cwæþ: Ic geseah wingeard.
On þam wæron þreo clystru, & ic geseah þæron weaxende blostman litlum & litlum, & æfter þam blostmum winberian.
& Pharaones drincefæt on minre handa, & ic nam þa winberian & wrang on þæt fæt & sealde Pharaone.
Ða cwæþ Iosep: þys is þin swefn: ða þreo clystru, þæt sind gyt þry dagas.
Æfter þam Pharao geþencþ þine ðenunga & he geset þe to þære ylcan note þe þu ær hæfdest, & þu sylst him hys drincefæt swa þu ær didest.
Geþence me þonne þe þin wise licie, & lære Pharao þæt he me ut alæde of þison cwearterne.
For ðam þe ic wæs dearnunga forstolen of Ebrea lande & her unscyldig on pit beworpen.
Ða þæra bæcestra ealdor gehyrde hu gleawlice he þæt swefn rehte, ða cwæð he: Ic geseah swefn, þæt is ðæt ic hæfde ðry windlas mid melewe ofer min heafod.
& on þam yfemestan windle wære manegra cynna gebæc, & fugelas ætan of þam.
Ða andswarode Iosep, & cwæð: þys is þin swefn: ða þri windlas, þæt synd þry dagas nu gyt.
& æfter þam hæt Farao þe ahon on rode & fugelas fretaþ ðyn flæsc.
Syððan wæs se þridda dæg Pharaones gebyrdtid: þa worhte he micelne beorscipe his cnihtum; gemang þam ða geþohte he þæra byrla ealdor & þæra bæcestra.
& he gesette þæra byrla magyster to þære note þe he ær hæfde.
Þone oþerne he het hon on gealgan.
Ða wæs Iosepes soþfæstnys afandod.
& þeahhwæþere þæra byrla ealdor forgeat Iosepes ærende.
ÆFTER twam gearum Pharao mætte þæt he stode be anre ea.
& him þuhte þæt he gesawe gan up of þam flode seofon fægre oxan & swiþe fætte, & hi man læsude on morigum lande.
Him þuhte eac þæt he gesawe cuman oþre seofon oxan up of þære ea, þa wæron fule & swiþe hlæne, & hi eodon be þære ea ofrun on grenum stowum.
& abiton þa fætte oxan & fræton hi; ða awoc Farao.
& slep eft, & hine mætte oþer swefn; Him þuhte þæt he gesawe seofon ear weaxan on anum healme fulle & fægere.
& he geseah oþre seofan lyþre & forscruncene.
Ða fræton ealle þa fægeran; ða awoc Pharao of slæpe.
On morgen he wearþ swiðe forht, & sende to Egypta wisoste witan & rehte him his swefen & bæd þæt hi him sædon hwæt ðæt swefn beheolde.
Þa geþohte ðæra byrla ealdor, hu he rehte hys swefn Iosepe, & cwæþ: Se cyning wæs yrre wiþ me & het sceofan me & þæra bæcistra ealdor on cweartern.
Þa mætte unc begen swefen on anre nihte.
Þa wæs þær an Ebreisc cnapa inne mid unc; þam wit rehton uncer swefn.
& he sæde unc eal swa hit syððan aeode: ic wæs eft geset to minre þenunge, & hine man heng, eal swa he unc ær sæde.
Hine man dide up be þæs cynges bebode & hine man efesode & scrydde hine & brohte hine to þam cynge.
Farao cwæþ: Ic geseah swefn & ic ne mæg nanne man findan, þe me secge hwæt hit behealde: ic gehyrde secgan þæt þu wære gleaw þæron.
Þa cwæþ Iosep: Hwæt mæg ic don butan me God wisige?
Witodlice Pharao rehte Iosepe þa swefn, þe hine mætte, eal swa hit herbufan awriten is, be þam oxum & be þam earum.
& cwæð: Ic hit rehte þam yldestan Egypta witan, & næs heora nan þe þær ænig ðing on cuðe.
Þa andswarode Iosep & cwæþ: þys swefn is anræde; God ætywde Pharaone hwæt he don wile.
Þa seofon fægeran oxan & þa seofon fægeran ear, ða getacniaþ seofon wæstmbære gear & welige.
Þa seofon hlænan oxan & þa seofon liþran ear getacniaþ seofon hungergear.
Nu her cumaþ seofon swiþe wæstmbære gear & swiþe welige ofer eall Egypta land.
& þæræfter cumaþ oðre seofone mid swa micelre wædle & hungre, þæt man forgyt ða ærran gear, & hunger fordeþ ealle eorþan.
Soþlice hit is Godes spræc & his warnung, & seo tid cymþ hrædlice.
Nu is hit ful wærlic, þæt se cyning him ceose sumne wisne man & gleawne & gesette ofer Egipta land.
& <gesette> gerefan geond eal þæt rice, þæt hi gegaderion togædere þone fiftan dæl ealra wæstma þas seofon wæstmbæran gear.
& þæt ælc hwæte, þe on Pharaones anwealde sy, sy belocen & on burgum gehealden.
To helpe on þam seofan toweardum hungorgearum, þæt Egypte ne forwurþon.
Þa licode Pharaone & eallum hys þegnum his ræd.
& he cwæþ to him: Hwar magon we findan swilcne man, þe mid Godes gyfe sy swa afilled?
Witodlice he cwæþ to Iosepe; God þe ætywde ealle þa þingc, þe þu spræce; hwær mæg ic wysran findan þonne þu eart, oþþe furþon þinne gelican?
Ic sette þe ofer eal Egypta land to gerefan & eal folc hyrþ ðe.
& he nam hys hring on hys agenra handa & dide on his hand, & scrydde hine mid linenum reafe & dide gyldene healsmyne ymbe hys swuran.
& sette hyne on hys oþer cræt & se bydel bead þæt eal folc bygdon heora cneowa beforan him & wiston þæt he wære gerefa ofer eal Egypta land.
Eft se cyning cwæþ to Iosepe: Ne færþ nan man butan þinum gebode ne hyder ne þider on eallum Egypta lande.

& he awende hys naman & nemde hine on Egyptisc, Middaneardes Hælend, & sealde him Aseneth to wyfe, Putiphares dohtor, þæs sacerdes, of þære byrig þe is genemned Eliopoleos, þæt is on Englisc, Sunnan Buruh.
Witodlice Iosep wæs þrittigwintre þa he embefor ealle Egypta ricu.
& gegaderode on ðam seofon wæstmbærum gearum swa micel hwætes, þæt his ne mihte nan man witan nan gemet, & beleac hine on burgum.
Ioseph gestrinde twegen suna ær þa hungergearas comon, Mannases, & Effraim.
Witodlice, þa þaviigodan gear agane wæron, þa comon þa seofon hungergear, þe Iosep foresæde, & þær weox hunger.
Þa þæt folc hingrode, þa clipodon hi to Pharaone, & bædon him metes; He andswarode & cwæð: Gaþ to Iosepe & doþ swa hwæt swa he eow secge.
Dæghwamlice hunger weox, & Iosep ontinde ealle þa bernu, & sealde hwæte þam Egyptiscum mannum to ceape.
ÐA gehyrde Iacob secgan þæt man sealde hwæte on Egypta lande, ða cwæþ he to hys sunum: Ic gehyrde secgan þæt hwæte wære on Egypta lande to ceape: farað & bicgaþ us mete, þæt we ne forwurþon.
Ða foron Iosepes tyn gebroþro to Egyptum & woldon bicgan hwæte.
& Iacob hæfde Beniamin æt ham.
Hy foron mid oþrum cypmannum; witodlice hungor wæs on Chanaan.
& Iosep wæs Egypta ealdor, & on his anwealde man sealde þone hwæte.

Þa his gebroþru to him comon, he gecneow hi ealle, & heora nan ne gecneow hine, & spræc heardlicor wið hi þonne wyþ fremde men, & cwæþ to him: Hwanon comon ge; þa cwædon hi: Of Chanaan lande, þæt we us mete bohton.
Ða gemunde Iosep þa swefen þe hine æt sumum cyrre ær gemætte, & cwæþ to hym: Ge syndon sceaweras.
Ða cwædon hi: Nis hit swa, hlaford, ac we sind þine þeowas, & we comon to þam þæt we bohton þa þing þe we mihton big libban.
Ealle we sind anes esnes suna; mid sibbe we comon hider næs mid searwum.
Ða cwæþ he: On oþre wisan hit is; ge comon þis land to sceawianne.
Ða cwædon hi: þa twelf þine þeowas sind gebroþru; hi sind anes esnes suna on Chanaan lande, & se gyngsta ys mid urum fæder & na ma.
Ðæt is þæt ic eow ær sæde, cwæþ he, ge sind sceaweras.
Swa ic age Pharaones helde, ne faraþ ge ealle heonon, ær þam þe eowwer læsta broþor cume hider.
Ac fare eower an & bringe hine hider, þæt ic wite hwæð hit sy þe soþ þe leas þæt ge secgaþ.
He betæhte hi ða þri dagas to hyrdnysse.
On þam þriddan dæge hi man lædde <of> þam cwearterne; & he cwæþ: Faraþ swa ic eow bebead, þæt ge magon libban: ic ondræde me God, gyf ic riht nabbe.
Beo eower an broðor her on cwearterne & fare ge mid þam hwæte þe ge bohton to eowrum husum, & lædaþ eowerne geongestan broþor to me; Hi didon swa he him bebead.

& cwædon him betwynan: Be gewyrhtum we þoliaþ þas þing; we singodon on urum breþer, & we gesawon hys angsumnysse, þa he us georne friðes bæd & we him nanes ne tiðodon; for þam com þis geswinc ofer us.
Ða cwæþ Ruben: Cweþe ge , ne sæde ic eow: Ne singie ge on þam cnapan, & ge me ne gehyrdon; Nu hine man wrihð.
Hy niston þæt Iosep hy gecneow.
& he wende hine lithwon fram him & weop, & wende eft to him & nam Simeon & band hine beforan him.
& bead his þegnum þæt hi gefyldon heora saccas mid hwæte, & ledon dearninga heora ælces feoh on hys sacc & formete toeacan; & hi didon swa.
& hi foron & læddon heora hwæte on heora assan.
Ða hi be wege wæron, þa undide heora an hys sacc & wolde sillan hys assan foddor.
Þa cwæþ he to his gebroþrum, þa he þæt feoh geseah on þæs sacces muþe: Her ic hæbbe funden min feoh on þis sacces muðe; ða wurdon hi afyrhte, & cwædon him betweonan: Hwæt is þis þæt God us dide?
Þa comon hi to Iacobe heora fæder on Chanaan lande, & rehton him ealle þa þing þe him on siðe gelumpon, & hu stiþe se landhlaford spræc wiþ hi, & cwædon: Se landhlaford wende þæt we wæron sceaweras.
& we cwædon: We sind ful getriwe; ne þence nanes ifeles.
Wexiigebroðra wæron anes esnes suna; se an is dead, & se gyngesta ys mid urum fæder.
Ða cwæþ he to us: Ic wille fandian hwæþer ge getriwe sind: lætaþ eowerne ænne broþor mid me, & nimaþ ða þing þe eowre hywan beþurfon, & faraþ.
& lædaþ eowerne gyngstan broðor to me, þæt ic wite þæt ge sceaweras ne sind, & þæt ge þysne eowerne broþor feccon, þe her on bendum sit, & þæt ge siþþan leafe habban to bicgeanne þæt þæt ge willað.
Ða hi ðus spæcon þa <guton> hi heora hwæte of heora saccum, & fundon þæron eall heora feoh; & hi wurdon ealle afærede.
Ða cwæð Iacob heora fæder: Bearnleasne ge habbað me gedonne; næbbe ic Iosep & Simeon ys on bendum; nu ge nimað Beniamin æt me.
Ða andswarode Ruben & cwæþ: Ic hæbbe twegen suna; ofsleah þa begen, gyf ic hine þe ongean ne bringe; Sile hine me on hand & ic hine agyfe eft þinre handa.
Ða cwæð Iacob: Ne færþ Beniamin mid eow: Iosep is dead, & he his ana to lafe; gyf him hwilc yfel on þam lande gelympð, æfre ic wurþe siððan geomriende.
GEMANG þam hungre, þa se mete geteorode, þe hi of Egypta lande brohton, Iacob cwæþ to his sunum: Faraþ & bicgaþ us sumne dæl metes.
Ða cwæð Iudas: þæs landes ealdor swor aþas beforan us þæt we ne moston cuman beforan him butan we bringon urne gyngestan broþor myd us.
Witodlice gyf ðu wilt hine mid us sendan we farað ætgædere & bicgaþ ða þing þe we beðurfon.
Gyf þu þonne nelt, ne cume we þonne þær.
Ða cwæþ Ysrahel to him: Earmlice didon ge wið me, þa ge him sædon þæt ge a ma gebroþra hæfdon.

Þa cwædon hi: Se man us axode eal be endebyrdnysse ymbe ure cyn, & hwæþer ure fæder leofode, & hwæþer we broþor hæfdon, & we him andswarodon þæs ðe he us axode: we niston þæt he þæs gyrnan wolde, þæt we urne broþor þider læddan.
Iudas cwæþ eft to his fæder: Send þone cnapan mid me, þæt we magon bicgean þa þing þe we beþurfon, þæt we ne forwurðon.
Ic underfo þone cnapan: bide hys me eft, & buton ic hine bringe eft ham & þe sille, beo ic scyldig.
Gyf þeod ylding nære, nu we wæron cumene oþre siðe.
Ðe cwæð Israhel: Gyf ge nyde swa don sceolon, doþ swa ge willon; Nimaþ of eowrum selostan wæstmum on fatum & bringaþ þam men lac, sumne dæl tyrwan & hunig & stor & æcyrnu & <hnyte>.
& twa swa micel feos swa ge ær hæfdon, þe læs ðe ge sind gedwelode.
& nimaþ eowerne broðor & faraþ to þam men.
Min Drihten hine gedo glædne wiþ eow, þæt he agyfe eow eowerne broðor þe he mid him hæfð, & eac Beniamin: ic eom nu bereafod minra bearna.
Ða namon hi ða lac & twifeald feoh & Beniamin & foron to Egypta lande to Iosepe.
Þa he hi geseah & Beniamin mid him, ða cwæþ he to hys geferan: Læde in þas men & gearwa ure þenunga, þæt hi magon etan mid me to middæges.

& he dide swa him beboden wæs; þa hy þærinne wæron, þa <wurdon> hig swiðe afyrhte, & cwædon hym betwynan: For þam feo þe we on urum saccum fundon we sind hyder in gelædde, þæt he us æt urum assum bereafige & æt urum þingum & us sylfe þeowige.
Ða cwædon hi to þam wicnere.
We biddaþ þe, leof, þæt þu hliste ure spæce: Hwilum ær we wæron her & bohton us hwæte.
Ða we geceapod hæfdon & we hamweard wæron, þa undidon we ure saccas; þa fundon we þæt feoh þæron, þe we ær sealdon; nu hæbbe we hit broht ongean be þam ylcan gewihte.
& eac oþer seolfor mid to ceapianne; nyte we hwa hit on ure saccas dide.

Ða cwæþ se gerefa: Sib sy mid eow: ne ondræde ge eow; eower Godd & eowres fæder Godd eow sealde goldhord on eowre saccas; Witodlice ðæt feoh, þe ge me sealdon, ic hæbbe afandod, & he lædde Simeon ut mid hym.
& þwogon heora fet & he sealde heora assan foddor.
Soþlice hi ledon forð heora lac ongean þæt Iosep in eode.
& feollon on þa eorþan & geeaðmeddon wiþ hine.
Iosep hi oncneow ða arfullice, & axode hi hwæþer heora fæder wære hal, þe hi him foresædon, oþþe hwæðer he leofode.
Þa cwædon hi: Gesund is þin þeow ure fæder; gyt he leofaþ.
Ða Iosep geseah his gemeddredan broþor Beniamin, þa cwæþ he: Is þis se cnapa þe ge me foresædon; & eft he cwæþ: God gemiltsige þe, sunu min.
& he wearð swa swiðe astyrod, þæt him feollon tearas for his broþor þingon; & he eode in to his bedcleofan & weop.
& þa he þæs geswac, þa eode he ut to him, & hi æton.
On sundron þa Egyptiscean, hit næs na alifed þæt hi ætgædere æton.
& hi man oferdrencte.
ÐA bead Iosep his gerefan, & cwæþ: Fille heora saccas mid hwæte & lege heora ælces feoh on his agenne sac.
& nim minne sylfrenan læfel & þæs hwætes wurð þe he sealde & do on þæs gyngestan sacc; & he dyde swa.
On merigen þa hy ferdon.

& hi wæron butan byrig & hæfdon sumne dæl weges gefaren, ða cwæþ Iosep to his gerefan: Aris & far æfter þysum mannum, & ðonne þu hi gefangen hæbbe, þonne axa þu hi, hwi hi woldon gyldan god mid yfele?
& se læfel þe ge forstælon wæs minum hlaforde swyðe dyre; yfele ge dydon.
He dyde swa hym beboden wæs; & þa hi gefangene wæron, hi cwædon.
Hwi tyhð ure hlaford us swa miceles falses?
Þæt feoh þe we fundon on urum saccum, we læddon to þe of Chanaan lande; wenstu þæt we stælon þines hlafordes gold oþþe hys seolfor?
Sece hit, & si he ofslegen, se þe þu hit mid fynde.
Ða cwæþ he: Sy hit swa ge cwædon; mid swa hwam swa ic hit mid fynde, beo he min þeow, & beon þa oþre clæne.
Hi efston þa, & didon heora saccas niþer.
& he sohte fram þam yldestan oþ þone gynstan, oþ he funde þone læfel on Beniamines sacce.
& hy wurdon swiþe dreorie, & semdon heora assan & cyrdon eft to þære byrig.
Ða eode Iudas fyrmest in mid hys broþrum to Iosepe, & hi feollon ealle ætgædere beforan Iosepe.
& he cwæþ to him; Hwi woldon ge swa don; Wendon ge þæt ge mihton be diddrian minne gelican?

Ða cwæþ Iudas to him: Hwæt magon we cweþan ongean urne hlaford; Næbbe we nane tale ongean þe; God hæfþ afandod ure unrihtwisnyssa; nu we synd ealle þine þeowas, ægþer ge we, ge se þe se læfel mid funden ys.
Ða cwæþ Iosep: Nelle Godd þæt ic swa do; ac si se min þeowa, þe þone læfel forstæl, & fare ge frige to eowrum fæder.
Ða eode Iudas hym near & spræc þristlicor wið hine: Ic bidde þe, hlaford, þæt ic mote butan irre wið þe specan; ðu eart min hlaford under Pharaone.
Þu axodest us ær hwæþer we hæfdon fæder oþþe modor.
& we cwædon: We habbaþ ealdne fæder, & he hæfþ mid him urne gynstan broþor þone he gestrynde on his ylde, & his gemedreda broþor wæs dead, & he lufaþ hine ænne ofer us ealle.
& þu bude us, þæt we hine læddan to þe, þæt þu hine gesawe & wistest be þam þæt we sceaweras næron; Nu we habbaþ hine earfoðlice begyten æt urum fæder & hine hider broht.
& ic swor aþas minum fæder þæt ic hine ham ongean to him brohte, & ic hine nam on minan truwan, & cwæþ to him: Butan ic hine ongean bringe eft to þe, ic beo æfre scyldig wið þe.
Hlaford min, læt þone cnapan faran ham mid his gebroþrum, & ic beo þin þeowa for hine.
Ne dear ic ham faran butan þam cnapan, þe læs þe ic geseo mines fæder sarnysse.
ÐA ne mihte Iosep hine leng dyrnan, ac he draf ealle þa Egyptiscan ut, þæt nan fremde man betwuh him nære.
& he weop & clypode hluddre stemne, þæt ða Egyptiscan gehyrdon, & eal Pharaones hyred.
& he cwæð to hys gebroþrum: Ic eom Iosep; leofaþ ure fæder nu gyt; ða ne mihton his gebroðru him for ege geandwyrdan.
Ða grette he hig arwurþlice, & cwæþ: Ic eom Iosep eower broðor, þe ge sealdon on Egipta land.
Ne ondræde ge eow nan þing, ne eow ne ofþince þæt ge me sealdon on þis rice; Soþlice for eowre þearfe me sende God on Egypta land.
Nu twa gear wæs hunger ofer ealle eorðan, & gyt sceolon fyfe on þam man ne mæg ne erian ne rypan.
& God me sende to þam þæt ge beon gehealdene, & þæt ge habbon þæt ge magon big libban.
Ðæt næs na eowres þances ac þurh God, þe ic þurh hys willan hider asend wæs: se dide me swylce ic Pharaones fæder wære & hys hyredes hlaford, & he sette me to ealdre ofer Egypta land.
Farað hrædlice to minum fæder, & secgaþ hym þæt God me sette to hlaforde eallum Egyptum: beodaþ him þæt he fare to me.
& wunige on Gessen lande & beo me gehende, he & hys suna & hys bearna bearn, & eower scep & eower hryþerheorda, & eal þæt ge agon.
& ic eow fede: gyt synd fif hungergear bæfton; doþ ðus, þæt ge ne forwurðon.
Nu ge geseoþ hu hit mid me is, & ge gehyrað hwæt ic eow sprece.
Cyþað mynum fæder eal min wuldor & ealle þa þingc þe ge gesawon on Egypta lande: efstaþ & lædaþ hine to me.
& he clypte heora ælcne & cyste hig & weop; æfter þison hi dorston sprecan wiþ hine.
Ða spræc man ofer eal & widmærsode þæt Iosepes broðru comon to Pharaone, & Pharao wæs glæd, & eal hys hyred.
& he bead Iosepe þæt he bude hys broþrum, & þus cwæþ: Symað eowre assan & farað to Chanaan lande.
& nimað þær eowerne fæder & eowre mægþe & cumað to me, & ic eow sille ealle Egypta god.
Beod him eac þæt hi nimon wænas to heora cyldfære & to heora gemæccena, & beod heom eac þæt hy niman heora fæder, & efston hider swa hyg raþost magon.
& ne forlæte ge nan þingc of eowrum iddisce, for þam ealle Egypta speda beoþ eowre.
Israheles suna dydon swa heom beboden wæs, & Iosep him sealde wænas, eal swa Pharao hym bead, & formete.
& sealde heora ælcum twa scrud, & he sealde Beniamine fif scrud & þreohundryd sylfrynga.
& he sende hys fæder tyn assan þa wæron gesymed mid feo & mid hrægle & mid Egypta welum, & tyn ðe bæron hwæte & hlaf.
Witodlice he let þa hys gebroðru faran & cwæð to hym: Ne forlæte ge nan þing be wege, ac beoð swyðe gesome.
Hy foron of Egypta lande & comon to Chanaan lande to Iacobe heora fæder.
& cwædon to hym: Iosep leofaþ, þin sunu, & wealt ealles Egypta landes; ða Iacob þæt gehyrde, þa þuhte hym swylce he of <hefegum> slæpe awæcnode, & þeah hym ne gelyfde.
Hy rehton hym heora færeld be endebyrdnysse, & þa he geseah þa wænas & ealle þa ðyngc, þe hym gesende wæron, hys gast wearþ geedcwicod.
& he cwæð: Genoh ic hæbbe, gyf Iosep myn sunu gyt leofaþ; ic fare & geseo hyne, ær þam ic swelte.
ISRAHEL ferde þa mid eallum þam þe he hæfde, oþ þæt he com to aþsware pytte, & þær offrode lac Isaaces Gode hys fæder.
& God hyne gehirde & clypode hyne, & cwæþ to hym: Iacob, Iacob; & he hym andswarode & cwæþ: Her ic eom.
& God cwæð to him: Ic eom se strensta God þines fæder; ne ondræd þu þe, ac far on Egypta land, for þam ðe ic do þe þær weligne.
Ic fare ðider mid þe, & ðanon ic ðe læde.
Iacob aras þa fram þam pytte, & his suna hine namon mid lytlingum & mid heora wyfum & mid þam wænum, þe Farao þider sende þone ealdan man on to ferianne.
& ealle þa þingc þe he ahte on Chanaan lande; & he com on Egypta land mid eallum hys cynne.
Soðlice þys synd Ysrahela bearna naman, þe in foron on Egypta land, he mid hys sunum: se phrumcenneda Ruben.
Rubenes suna: Enoh & Phallu & Charm.
Simeones suna: Gamuel & Diamin & Achod & Iachim & Saher & Saul, Chananides suna.
& Leuies Sues suna: Ierson & Chaath & Merari.
Iudas suna: Her & Onam & Sela & Phares & Zaram; Her & <Onam> forðferdon on Chanaan lande, & Farase wæron suna acennede Esrom & Amul.
Isachares suna: Thola & Fua & Iob & Semrom.
Zabulones suna: Sared & Elon & Iaelel.
Ðys sind Lian suna, þe heo cende on Mesopotamie Sirie, mid Dina hire dehter; þæt wæron ealra þreo &xxxmid sunum & mid dohtrum.
Gades suna: Sephio & Thagis, Suni & Essebon, Her & Arodi & Areli.
Asseres suna: Gamne & Gessui & Gessua & Beria, & Sara heora swustor; Berian suna: Hebel & Melchiel.
Rachele suna Iacobes wifes: Iosep & Beniamin.
& Iosep gestrynde suna on Egypta lande be Aseneth, Putiphares dehter þæs sacerdes of Elipoleus, Manases & Efraim.
Beniamines suna; Bela & Bechor & Asbel & Gera & Naam; Hehi & Ros, Moym & Oppham & Ared.
Rachel acende Iacobe feowertyne suna.
Danis suna: Husim.
Neptalines suna: Hasiel & Guni & Iesser & Salem.
Witodlice Iacob ferde hundseofontigra sum on Egypta land.
He sende Iudas beforan him to Iosepe, & he cydde hym þæt he come ongean hine to Iessen.
Ða he ðyder com, Iosep gegearwode hys cræt & for ongean his fæder, & þa he hine geseah he clypte hyne & weop.
& Iacob cwæð: Nu ic mæg sweltan blyðelice nu ic þe geseo & þe mine æhta betæcean.
& Iosep cwæþ to his broðrum & to ealre hys ræddene: Ic fare & ciðe Faraone þæt ge comon to me.
& ic secge him þæt ge synd hyrdas & habbaþ broht hider mid eow eal þæt ge ahton.
& þonne he eow clypað & axaþ hwæt ge don cunnon.
Þonne secge hym þæt ge synd scephyrdas fram cyldhade, ge we ge ure fæderas, oþ ðisne andweardan dæg; Secgaþ ðus, þæt ge magon eardian on Gessen lande, for þam þe ealle Egyptisce onscuniað scephyrdas.
ÞA eode Iosep in to Pharaone, & cwæð to him: Min fæder & mine gebroþu & heora scepheorda & heora hryþerheorda & ealle þa þing þe hig agon comon of Chanaan lande, & nu hi synd on Gessen lande.
Witodlice he lædde his fif gingstan broðru beforan þone cyngc.
Þa he axode hwæt hy wyrcean cuþon: hi andswarodon & cwædon: We synd scephyrdas, ðine þeowas, we & ure fæderas.
We comon to þam þæt we wunodon on þinum lande, for þam þe we nabbaþ nan gærs urum heordum, & hungor wyxt on Chanaan; & we biddaþ þæt we þine þeowas beon moton on Iessen lande.
Þa cwæð se cining to Iosepe: þin fæder & þine gebroþru comon.
Þu canst Egypta land; geloga hi on þære selestan stowe, & sile him Iessen land, & gyf þu wite þæt hig gleawe synd, sete hi to ealdrum ofer mine heorda.
Æfter þisum lædde Iosep hys fæder in to þam cyninge, & sette hine beforan; þa bletsode he hine & axode hine, hu eald he wære.
Þa andswarode he him & cwæð: Anhundwintre &xxxwintre.
& se cining hine bletsode, & he eode ut.
Iosep sealde his gebroþrum tun on Egypta lande, on þam selistan ende, Ramases, eal swa Farao him bead, & fedde hi & ealle his fæder hiwrædene.
Soþlice hlaf wæs wana on eallum ymbhwyrftum, & hungor fornam swyþost Egypte & Chanaan land.
& Iosep hæfde gegaderod eal þæt feoh þe hi ahton, & gebroht on þæs cyninges maðmhuse.
Þa heora feoh geteorode, þa com eall Egypta folc to Iosepe, & cwædon to him: Sile us mete; hwi swelte we beforan þe, nu we feoh nabbaþ?
He andswarode him & cwæþ: Drifaþ hider eowre orf, gyf ge feoh nabbaþ, & ic eow sille þærwiþ mete.
& hi didon swa, & he sealde him andlifene wiþ horsum & wiþ hriðerum & wið sceapum & wið assan, & fedde hi þæt gear wið heora orfe.
Ða comon hi eft to him on þam æftran geare, & cwædon: Ne hele we þe, hlaford, þæt we nabbað naþor ne feoh ne orf; & þu silf wast þæt we nan þing nabbaþ buton land & lichaman.
Hwi swelte we beforan ðe; We & ure land beoþ ðine; bige us to þæs cyncges þeowote & sile us sæd, þæt þæt land ne licge weste & we forwurþon.
Witodlice Iosep bohte eal Egypta land, þa hy cypton ealle heora hamas for þæs hungres micelnysse; & he betæhte hi Pharaone.
& eal heora folc fram ende oþ oþerne Egypta landes, buton þæra sacerda land, ðe se cyning him sealde: þa man fedde of þæs cyninges berene, for þam hi ne sealdon heora land.
Ða cwæþ Iosep to þam folce: Nu ge silfe witon þæt Farao ah ægþer ge eow ge eowwer land; nimaþ sæd & sawaþ þæt land.
Þæt ge habbon wæstmas, & sillaþ þam cyninge þone fiftan dæl: þa feower ic eow lyfe to sæde & to mete eow & eowrum hiwum & eowrum bearnum.
Hi andswaredon, & cwædon: æt þe is ure lyf gelang; beseoh to us, & we þeowiaþ bliðelice þam cyninge.
Of þam dæge oþ þisne andweardan man gilt þam cynincge þone fiftan dæl ofer eal Egypta land to gesetnysse, buton þam sacerdlande, þe wæs æfre frig.
Witodlice Israhel wunode on Egipta, þæt is on Gessen lande, & ahte þæt & wæs gemænifyld swiðe.
& leofode þæron seofentyne gear; ealle hys lifes dagas wæron hundteontig wintra & seofon &xlwintra.

& þa he geseah ðæt is endedæg him genealæhte, he clypode Iosep hys suna, & cwæþ to him: Sete þine hand under min þeoh, & cyð me þine soþfæstnysse & swera me þæt þu me næfre ne bebirige on Egypta lande.
Ac do þæt ic reste myd minum fæderum: læde me of þisum lande, & bebirig me mid minum yldrum.
& Iosep swor þæt he swa don wolde.
ÐA þis wæs ðus gedon, ða cydde man Iosepe þæt his fæder wære gesycled, & he nam hys twegen suna, Mannases & Efraim, & com þyder.
Ða cydde man Ysrahele þæt Iosep his suna wær cumen; þa elnode he hine & sæt up.
& cwæð, þa he in eode: ælmihtig God me ætywde on Luza, þæt is on <Chanaan> lande, & bletsode.
& cwæþ: Ic þe gemænigfylde & ic sille þe þis land & þinum cynne æfter þe to ecre æhte.
Witodlice þine twegen suna, ða þe acennede wæron on Egypta lande ær þam ic hyder come, hi beoþ mine, Ephraim & Mannases swa Ruben & Symeon beoþ mid me getealde, & farað mid me.
Staþala þu ða oþre on heora hamon.
Me wæs Rachel dead be wege þa ic for of Mesopotamie on Chanaan lande: hit wæs lenctentid, & ic for to Eufrata & bebirigde hy wið þone weg þe is on Eufrata: seo ys on oþre naman genemned Bethleem.
Ða he hys suna geseah, þa cwæð he: Hwæt sind þas?
He andwyrde, & cwæð: Mine suna, ðe me God sealde on þysre stowe; ða cwæþ he: Læde hi to me, & ic hi bletsige.
Israeles eagon þistrodon for þære miclan ilde, þæt he ne mihte beorhte geseon; ða fette hi man to hym, & he cyste hi.
& cwæþ to his suna: Gode þanc þæt ic þe hæbbe & þæt ic þine suna geseah.
& Iosep hi nam of þæs fæder bearme, & he abeah to þære eorþan & geeaðmedde hine.
& sette Efraim on his swyþran hand, þæt wæs on Israheles wynstran hand, & Mannases on his winstran hand, þæt wæs on Israheles swiþran healfe, & dide begen to him.
He hefde þa his swyþran hand ofer Efraimes heafod, þæs gyngran broðor, & hys winstran ofer Mannases heafod, þe yldra wæs.

& he bletsode Iosep hys sunu, & cwæþ: Drihten, þu þe mine fæderas on þinre sihðe eodon, Abraham & Isaac; God, ðu þe me feddest fram cyldhade oþ ðysne dæg: Se encgel þe me nerede of eallum yfelum bletsige þas cnapan, & si min nama genemned ofer hi, & minra fædera Abrahames & Isaaces, & weaxen hi manifealdlice on eorþan.
Ða Iosep geseah þæt his fæder sette his swiþran hand ofer Efraimes heafod, he wearþ swiðe sarig, & nam þæs fæder hand & ðohte hi to ahebbenne of Efraimes heafde & gesettan ofer Mannases heafod.
& cwæþ to his fæder: Ne gebireþ hit swa, fæder, for þam þe he is frumcenned: sete þine swiþran hand ofer his heafod.
Ða onscunode he þæt, & cwæþ: Ic wat, sunu, ic wat; þes biþ gemænigfild on folce & his gingra broþor bið his ealdor & his cyn wyxt on þeoda.
& he bletsode hi, & cwæþ: On þe biþ gebletsod Ysrahela God, & be eow man cwyþ ðus: Si God mid þe swa he wæs myd Efraime & Mannases.
& cwæþ to Iosepe hys suna: Nu ic swelte & God biþ mid eow & eow eft gelæt to eowra fædera lande.
Ic sille þe anne dæl toforan þinum broþrum, þone ic nam of Amoreus handum mid gefeohte.
SOþLICE Iacob clypode his suna, & cwæþ to him: Beoþ ætgædere þæt ic eow cyþe þa þing þe eow towearde sind, & hu eower ælcon gebireþ ær his ende.
He him sæde þa swa hit on þære Ledenbec awriten is, ræde þær se þe wille.
Ða he hit him eal asæd hæfde, ða bletsode he ælcne on sundron.
& cwæþ to him: Bebyriaþ me mid minum fæderum on þam twifealdan scræfe þe is on Ephrones lande, þæs Etheiscan.
Þæt Abraham bohte æt Ephrone þam Etheiscean him to byrgenne.
Ðær hine man birigde & Sarran his wif; ðær wæs Isaac bebiriged mid Rebeccan; & þær lið Lia bebyriged.
& þa he þus gesprecen hæfde, he feold his fet uppan his bed & geendode, & wæs to his folce gelæd.
ÐA Iosep þæt geseah, þa feol he uppan hine & weop.
& bead his þeowan læcean, þæt hi mid wyrtgemangum hine behwurfon: hi didon swa.
Feowertig daga hit wæs þeaw þæt man sceolde wepan ælcne deadne mannan, & eal þæt folc hine weop hundseofontig daga.
Ða þæs wopes dagas agane wæron, Iosep cwæþ to Pharaones hirede: Secgaþ Faraone.
Þæt min fæder me bæd þæt ic hine bebyrigde on þære byrgene þe he silf dealf on Chanaan lande: biddað hine þæt he me sille leafe.
& Pharao cwæþ: Far & bebirge þinne fæder swa he þe bæd.
He for þa, & Pharaones ildstan hiredmen foron mid him, & ealle þa betstborenan on Egypta lande mid him foron.
& eac his gebroþru mid & eal heora hiwræden, buton geongum litlingum & hyrdum ða hi forleton on Gessen lande.
He hæfde on his geferræddene cratu & ridende men, & þær wæs micel folc.
Ða foron hi oþ hi comon to þære þirsceflore þe is begeondan Iordanen; þar hi wæron seofon dagas fulle, & þær mærlice þæt lic behwurfon mid miclum wope.
Ða þæt gesawon þa Chananeiscean, þa cwædon hi: þis is micel wop þissa Egiptiscra manna; & for þam hi nemdon þa stowe Egypta Wopstow.
Witodlice Iacobes suna didon eal swa he him bebead.
& feredon hine to Chanaan lande & hine þær bebyrigdon on þam twifealdan scræfe þe Abraham bohte mid lande mid ealle to licreste æt Ephrone ðam Etheiscan ongean Mambre.
& Iosep gewende to Egypta lande mid his gebroþrum & eallum his geferum, siþþan his fæder bebyriged wæs.
Æfter þisum his gebroþru him ondredon & spæcon hym betweonan: Wenan we magon þæt he geþence þone teonan þe we him ær didon, & þæt he us mid yfele leanige.

& hi cwædon to him: Vre fæder bead us, ær þam þe he forðferde, þæt we sædon þe þas word: Ic bidde þe, sunu min, þæt ðu forgife þone gilt & þa unrihtwisnesse þe hi wiþ ðe worhton; We biddaþ þe eac þæt þu hit us þæs Godes þances, þines fæder, forgife; ða Iosep þæt gehirde, þa weop he.
& his gebroþru bugon to him, & cwædon: We sindon þine þeowas.
Ða andswarode he him & cwæþ: Ne ondræde ge eow: cweþe ge, magon we Godes willan onscunian?
Ge þohton yfele be me & God gewende þæt yfel to gode, þæt he me up ahofe, swa ge nu geseoþ & he gehælde manega folc.
Ne ondrædaþ eow; ic eow fede & eowwer litlingas; & he frefrode hi & spræc glædlice.
& wunode on Egypta lande mid ealre his fæder hiwrædene, & he leofode anhund wintra & tyn gear; & he geseah Efraimes suna oþ þa ðriddan cneorissae.
Macharies suna, Manases suna, wæron acennede on Iosepes anwealde.
Ða þis wæs ðus gedon, he cwæþ to his gebroþrum: æfter minum deaðe God cymþ to eow & deþ ðæt ge faraþ of þison lande to þam lande þe ic swor Abrahame & Isaace & Iacobe.
& he cwæþ: Lædaþ mine ban of þisum lande.
Iosep forþferde þa he wæs anhund wintra & tinwintre, & hine man bebyrigde mid wyrtgemange: he wæs gelæd of his stowe of Egypta lande.
